title: Re-Mix @ PDX
name: Re-Mix @ PDX
description:
A Map by Kwolff

On May 21, CEOs for Cities (and our own City of Roses) will host &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.charlesleadbeater.net/home.aspx&quot;&gt;Charles Leadbeater&lt;/a&gt; on the first of his four-day &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.ceosforcities.org/rethink/&quot;&gt;Re-Mix Tour&lt;/a&gt;. Here's where we plan to be.

properties.name: ACE Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Kwolff 1022 SW Stark St, Portland, OR 97205You are staying at the Ace Hotel. For more info, check out the NYT Travel Magazine (April 2007). Get a cup of coffee at Stumptown (in the hotel) to begin your day. You will not regret it.

properties.name: Community Cycling Center
properties.description: Posted by Kwolff1700 Ne Alberta St, Portland, ORWe\'re meeting Alison Hill here about 10:45am.

properties.name: Disjecta
properties.description: Posted by Kwolff230 E Burnside St, Portland, ORThe May 21 City Repair Village Building Convergence event, "Stories of Place", begins at 7:00. Look here.

properties.name: East Bank Commerce Center
properties.description: Posted by Kwolff1001 SE Water St., Portland, OR 97214We\'ll meet in Brad Malsin\'s office (the conference room - enter from the parking entrance and turn left) at 9:30am for a lively discussion about the role of arts and culture in Portland\'s creative ecosystem. Participants include: CIty Commissioner Sam Adams; Disjecta Executive Director Bryan Suereth and board members Brad Malsin, Kristin, Wolff, Jo Ann Kemmis, and Daniel Deutsch; P:ear Executive Direct Beth Burns and Board member Rosie Williams.

properties.name: Ecotrust Building
properties.description: Posted by Kwolff721 NW 9th Ave., Portland, OR 97209The Jean Vollum Natural Capital Center (we call it the "EcoTrust Building" or just "Eco-Trust") is where we plan to meet for coffee (2:00pm) with some amazing people from the open source community (World Cup Coffee on the first floor), and for the "Salon" with a group of sustainability and community organizations and activist groups right afterwards (3:00, in the conference room of the Office of Sustainable Development). The Center is also home to Hot Lips Pizza and Patagonia sportwear.

properties.name: J&M Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Kwolff 537 SE Ash St Portland, ORBreakfast. Go for the waffle. Here\'s a recent review. Breakfast at 7:30 with Ethan Seltzer et. al.

properties.name: Lorenzo's
properties.description: Posted by Kwolff3807 N Mississippi Ave, portland oregonSoup and fennel salad are reliable winners. If it\'s nice day, the front garage-style door will be open. We\'ll meet here between 11:45 and noon.

properties.name: Pazzo Ristorante
properties.description: Posted by Kwolff627 Sw Washington St, Portland, ORDinner. Fun. 6:00.

properties.name: ReBuilding Center
properties.description: Posted by Kwolff3625 N Mississippi, Portland, OR 97227Must see to believe.
